title: intro
text: Fetches latest posts. Returns data frame columns: slug url title description excerpt body_html reading_time_minutes audio_url date likes paywall cover_image cover_image_color_palette author author_image

title: intro
text: Fetches top (liked) posts.

title: intro
text: Searches posts keyword.
code: search_results <- get_substack_search(   publication_url = "posocap.substack.com",   query           = "data science",   limit           = 20 )

title: intro
text: Retrieves single post slug.

title: intro
text: Missing API key → error asking run set_substack_key(). HTTP errors (4xx, 5xx, rate limits) → cli::cli_abort() status code message. JSON parsing issues → warning + empty data frame.

title: Access Substack Data via API
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(substackR) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Latest Posts — get_substack_latest
text: Fetch latest posts Substack publication.

title: Latest Posts — get_substack_latest
text: publication_url Character, e.g. "example.substack.com". limit Integer [1–50], default 10. offset Integer >= 0, default 0.

title: Latest Posts — get_substack_latest
text: data.frame (possibly zero‐row) post records.

title: Get Single Post — get_substack_post
text: Fetch single post slug. Returns one‐row data.frame, zero‐row found.

title: Get Single Post — get_substack_post
text: publication_url Character. slug Character. Post slug.

title: Get Single Post — get_substack_post
text: data.frame one row (zero rows missing).

title: Search Posts — get_substack_search
text: Search posts Substack publication. zero results, returns empty data.frame.

title: Search Posts — get_substack_search
text: publication_url Character, e.g. "example.substack.com". query Character. Search term. limit Integer [1–50], default 10. offset Integer >= 0, default 0.

title: Search Posts — get_substack_search
text: data.frame (possibly zero‐row).

title: Top Posts — get_substack_top
text: Fetch popular posts Substack publication.

title: Top Posts — get_substack_top
text: publication_url Character, e.g. "example.substack.com". limit Integer [1–50], default 10. offset Integer >= 0, default 0.

title: Top Posts — get_substack_top
text: data.frame (possibly zero‐row) post records.

what: Set your Substack API Key — set_substack_key
title: Set your Substack API Key — set_substack_key
text: Store key per session. Subsequent calls functions use key automatically.

title: Set your Substack API Key — set_substack_key
Set your Substack API Key — set_substack_key
text: key single string: Substack API key.

title: Set your Substack API Key — set_substack_key
text: Invisibly TRUE successful.
